body: Where are you seeing in that doc is shows size used for the drive? I'm sure I'm missing it, but wanted to validate.

It's a little confusing because there are four variants of "user," and two of them don't include that information. If you select the "Standard" or "Full" variants, scroll down to find 2 fields `space_amount` and `space_used`.
Awesome. Thanks for pointing that out as I see it now!

This looks straight forward to implement - we'd have to [call /users/me](https://developer.box.com/reference/get-users-me/).

I had a quick go at this

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.51.0-361-g19073993-fix-4264-box-about-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Does it work for you? If not please run with `-vv --dump bodies` and paste the result!

Great!

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.52

I'm running the latest beta: `rclone v1.51.0-369-g4599e484-fix-4210-pcloud-oauth-beta`, which includes the last fix regarding this issue.
`BOX` is the name of my Box remote, and indeed I can successfully query the quota:
```
user@host ~$ rclone about BOX:
Total:   10G
Used:    247.980M
```
when trying a backup through `rclone sync` to a remote which is the encrypted union of BOX and other stuff, though, I get a lot of NOTICE warnings.
```
user@host ~$ rclone -vP sync ~/my/local/path CRYPT-UNION:remote/path

NOTICE: Free Space is not supported for upstream BOX, treating as infinite
```
is this expected, given the new `about` capabilities for Box? thanks!

I would think so as this request was to add in the about and not rewrite the entire backend :)

You can probably submit an feature request to get that updated as well.

I thought the `union` remote would have used the information now available from `about`, since that's the quota information...

if you confirm this is expected, could you please help me out in phrasing the new feature request?
_please add support to quota information about Box.com in union remote_?

> ```
> user@host ~$ rclone -vP sync ~/my/local/path CRYPT-UNION:remote/path
> 
> NOTICE: Free Space is not supported for upstream BOX, treating as infinite
> ```
> 
> 
> is this expected, given the new `about` capabilities for Box? thanks!

That is possibly a bug in the union backend. I've fixed it in the box about code here c08617c70f9740d1050888489df49189160523d7 so if you try [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) it should work a bit better.

so it was a one-liner, after all! no need to rewrite the backend... see, @animosity22? :satisfied:

@ncw a quick test seems to be working! thanks! you really are a bug sniper! :+1:
The integration tests (run daily) noticed the problem first so I had fixed it before I saw your comment!

issue.title: Add about support for Box

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-)

So you've got an idea to improve rclone? We love that! You'll be glad to hear we've incorporated hundreds of ideas from contributors already.

Here is a checklist of things to do:

  1. Please search the old issues first for your idea and +1 or comment on an existing issue if possible.
  2. Discuss on the forum first: https://forum.rclone.org/
  3. Make a feature request issue (this is the right place!).
  4. Be prepared to get involved making the feature :-)

Looking forward to your great idea!

The Rclone Developers

-->


#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

1.5.10

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

Please add support for command rclone about Box: . I am using the rclone mounted Box: storage in conjunction with mergerfs. The other merged storage is 4shared.com. Firstly the data was written to Box: storage and the drive was fully written, no space has left.

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

 Without the ability to check the available free space on the mounted storage, mergerfs has no chance to send the data to the other merged drive when this would be needed. Google drive and Yandex both supports the rclone about command, mergerfs worked with them perfectly. Adding rclone about Box: support would solve my problem.
